column4: Sept. 26 (Xinhua) — The Asian Development Bank (ADB) forecast Cambodia’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth to maintain its strong momentum in 2018 with strong performances expected in exports and domestic demand
column5: said its press release on Wednesday.------In an update of its flagship publication
column7: ADB forecast the economic growth for Cambodia at around 7 percent for 2018 and 2019
column8: in line with stable growth across most of developing Asia and moderate strength in the major industrial economies.------“Cambodia’s economy continues to expand at a robust pace
column13: ” ADB Country Director for Cambodia Sunniya Durrani-Jamal said in the release.------“Rapidly rising wages without increased productivity
column15: could pose a major domestic risk
column17: which still mainly relies on cheap labor
column18: ” she said.------Merchandise exports rose by 13.3 percent and imports by 25.7 percent because of strong domestic demand in the first half of 2018
column19: the release said.------It added that the current account deficit excluding official transfers will rise to 12.1 percent of GDP this year
column21: but it is expected to narrow next year

column25: mainly supported by tourist arrivals from China
column26: the release said.------It said the overall balance of payment should remain in surplus due to strong inflows of foreign direct investment

column28: from 9.1 billion U.S. dollars in July 2018 to around 10 billion U.S. dollars by the end of 2018
